name: Ext_R5_ActorDefinition
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.ActorDefinition for use in FHIR R4B
description: This cross-version extension represents ActorDefinition from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ActorDefinition|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4B.

element.short: An application that exchanges data
element.definition: Describes an actor - a human or an application that plays a role in data exchange, and that may have obligations associated with the role the actor plays.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this actor definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this actor definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this actor definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the actor definition is stored on different servers.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this actor definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this actor definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this actor definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the actor definition is stored on different servers.

element.short: Business version of the actor definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the actor definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the actor definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

element.short: Business version of the actor definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the actor definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the actor definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

element.short: How to compare versions
element.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

element.short: How to compare versions
element.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

element.short: Name for this actor definition (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the actor definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

element.short: Name for this actor definition (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the actor definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

element.short: Name for this actor definition (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the actor definition.

element.short: Name for this actor definition (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the actor definition.

element.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
element.definition: The status of this actor definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

element.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
element.definition: The status of this actor definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this actor definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this actor definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

element.short: Date last changed
element.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the actor definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the actor definition changes.

element.short: Date last changed
element.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the actor definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the actor definition changes.

element.short: Name of the publisher/steward (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the actor definition.

element.short: Name of the publisher/steward (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the actor definition.

element.short: Contact details for the publisher
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

element.short: Contact details for the publisher
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

element.short: Natural language description of the actor
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the actor.

element.short: Natural language description of the actor
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the actor.

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate actor definition instances.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction for actor definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the actor definition is intended to be used.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction for actor definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the actor definition is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.short: Why this actor definition is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this actor definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

element.short: Why this actor definition is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this actor definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

element.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the actor definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the actor definition.

element.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the actor definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the actor definition.

element.short: Copyright holder and year(s)
element.definition: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

element.short: person | system
element.definition: Whether the actor represents a human or an appliction.

binding.description: The type of actor - system or human.

element.short: Functionality associated with the actor
element.definition: Documentation about the functionality of the actor.

element.short: Reference to more information about the actor
element.definition: A reference to additional documentation about the actor, but description and documentation.

element.short: CapabilityStatement for the actor (if applicable)
element.definition: The capability statement for the actor (if the concept is applicable).

element.short: Definition of this actor in another context / IG
element.definition: A url that identifies the definition of this actor in another IG (which IG must be listed in the dependencies). This actor inherits all the obligations etc. as defined in the other IG.
